meanings.definition: A long body of water curling into an arched form and breaking on the shore.
meanings.sent1: The wave crashed loudly on the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the waves at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The wave seemed to playfully chase the seagulls on the shore.
meanings.sent4: She rode the wave of excitement all the way to the shore.
meanings.sent5: The gigantic wave towered over the tiny sandcastles.

meanings.definition: A gesture or signal made by moving one's hand to and fro.
meanings.sent1: He gave a friendly wave to his neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The crowd waved enthusiastically at the passing parade.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow's wave seemed to scare away the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her wave of goodbye was filled with warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The queen's wave was elegant and graceful.

meanings.definition: A sudden occurrence of or increase in a specified phenomenon.
meanings.sent1: There was a wave of laughter after the joke.
meanings.sent2: A wave of excitement swept through the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The sudden wave of hunger made him devour the entire pizza.
meanings.sent4: A wave of relief washed over her when she found her lost keys.
meanings.sent5: The wave of applause was deafening in the concert hall.
